events: Collaborated with KEMRI
Hosted by KEMRI-IAVI at Malindi Sub-county Hospital at the CCC Department
Registered as CBO for sexual minorities and marginalized groups (SOGIE Community)
Partnership with AMURT in provision of comprehensive HIV services to MSM 2013 - 2017
Took part in Test and Treat Program through mobilizing MSM peers in collaboration with KEMRI-IAVI
Established a Security Response Team (SRT) responding to human rights violations reporting as Nelion region of GALCK
Partnered in the 1st HIV Oral Self Testing piloting study
Partnership with Kenya Red Cross Society and set up of DICE
Partnership with UHAI EASHRI
Partnership with Health-Right International on PrEP study
Developed a 3-year strategic plan (2018 – 2020)
Reached 1,500 MSM with comprehensive services
Empowered 35 young MSMs into certified peer educators
Registered wellness centre as a clinic with the Ministry of Health
Initiated PrEP roll out
Trained 4 community paralegals through Red Cross Paralegal program
Sensitized 30 Boda Boda stakeholders
Opened a safe space for young MSM to relax
Participated in National Symposium offering MSM capacity building opportunities
Enrolled 200 MSW into PrEP
Tested 44 PLHIVs (2 not yet linked into care)
Participated in County/National TWGs
Offered livelihood support during the pandemic to 100 members (LGBT)
Sub-granted small grass root organizations during COVID period
Started the delivery of services to Lamu
Started the delivery of services to Tana River
Developed a 4-year strategic plan (2022 – 2026)
Hosted the F2BM (Free To Be Me) Global Outcome Harvest Convening
Expanded services to greater Kilifi county covering Kilifi North and Kaloleni sub-counties
Increased the Security Response Team (SRT) for ground surveillance and reporting mechanisms
Developed a Regional Needs Assessment on Social Economic Situation of the LGBTQ
Hosted the Kilifi MSM Integrated Biological Behavioural Surveillance Survey (IBBS) National Study with NASCOP
Hosting Tana River Bench Marking for KP implementation program
Opening a new level 2 clinic in Tana River for the GSM community
Hosted a global LGBTQ social economic strategic convening with GSM experts from different continents
Sub-granted 6 grass root creatives around social economic justice
